quote: Captain's log, Stardate 42686.4.   We are en route to Starbase   Montgomery for engineering   consultations prompted by minor   readout anomalies...
I would consider them   insignificant.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: What if you're wrong?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Sorry.       But what if it's more than a mere   discrepancy?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Then I'd say we have a problem.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Agreed. We'll have Starbase   Montgomery give us an independent   reading.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Even if the molecular level   controls failed, we could   recrystallize the dilithium   without outside help.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Data, don't worry. My ego isn't   at stake here.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Perhaps we could reprogram the   system to correct the readout   variables --
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: That's certainly an option, but   since we're stopping at Starbase   Montgomery anyway, we'll let them   do the analysis.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Sir? I don't recall Starbase   Montgomery on our mission   itinerary --
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: I think we could all use a   twelve-hour layover. Besides,   I've just received some personnel   transfer directives. Priority   matters --
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Boarding or disembarking?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Captain Picard, we're within   hailing range of Starbase   Montgomery --
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Reduce to impulse power --       Meet me in the Observation Lounge   when you're done here.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - RIKER, DATA, AND GEORDI

quote: Captain...

Number One, I find myself   recollecting the arrival of a new   first officer to the Enterprise   and a manual docking very   confidently achieved. I suspect   that I was somewhat miserly in   offering congratulations then,   so let me make up for it now.   Congratulations. The captain of   the Starship Ares is retiring.   You've been selected as his   replacement.
The Ares... she is in Vega-Omicron   sector.
And she's picked up indications   of an intelligent life-form...   but nothing conclusive.
Starfleet will want to know   more.
That's why they're asking you,   Number One. Not for your military   proficiency, but for your skill   as an explorer and diplomat.
Vega-Omicron. It'll take months   at high warp just to get there.
With no guarantee of finding   anything once you arrive. Well,   you have twelve hours to think   it over. And maybe it's premature,   but congratulations, "Captain."
Establish synchronous orbit.
Aye, sir.
Starbase Montgomery is sending   a civilian advisor aboard to brief   you on the Ares's mission.
A personal briefing?
Yes. Strategic attache with   specialized knowledge of the   frontier regions. I think you'll   find the briefing... very   interesting.
I hope it's complete. Much of   my decision will be based on it.
Commander Riker to the Transporter   Room.
Enjoy...
Ensign --
Ah, you're right on time,   Commander. He's on his way now...
Dad... ?
You're the civilian advisor? The   strategic attache?
I asked Captain Picard to keep   it quiet. I didn't want you to   get nervous... excited.
It's been fifteen years.   Excitement is hardly the   appropriate emotion.
You've done well. First officer   on the Enterprise is quite a   feather in your cap.
I've worked hard.
Of course. I'm proud of you,   Will --
If you'll excuse me, I've got my   duties to attend to. After you've   settled in, we'll complete the   briefing.       Have security send an escort for   this gentleman.
Did you hear about Commander   Riker's promotion?
Yes.
He didn't even know his father   was coming. It was a complete   surprise --
So?
Well, can you imagine if it was   your father?
I never knew my father.
And I didn't have one long   enough --
It is a waste of time to think   about such things.
I'm not thinking about it, really,   but everybody needs somebody,   don't you think -- ?
Enough!
Starbase Montgomery really didn't   have to send me all this help,   because we've already checked the   entire dilithium spectrum for   anomalous frequencies, so don't   waste your time on that --
Wes... you okay?
I was just talking to Worf.       He's somewhat eccentric at times.
That's one word for it.
But he was so upset -- I must've   said something wrong.
Maybe Worf's not too thrilled   with the idea of losing Commander   Riker to a new assignment. I'm   sure not --
Neither am I... But I think   it's something else with Worf...   something's really bothering   him.
Female?
Career?
Family.
That is trouble. You choose your   friends... you choose your   enemies... But family... that's   in the stars.
So I've heard.
Boliska! What in the name of   the Federation are you doing   here -- ?
Excuse me...
This is more than a surprise...   it's total shock.
You mean you didn't bake me a   cake?
You're actually here.
That makes two of us.    (then, re an empty     table)   How about a drink?
How about a kiss?
They know each other...
I know her too, but we don't do   that.
And it has nothing to do with   Commander Riker's new assignment?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: No. His reaction to that was just   the opposite of mine: Completely   unaffected.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: You see? With all that's going   on, you might be overreacting.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: Really? You try talking to Worf.   I'm telling you, he's not...   normal... for Worf.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: There is, of course, a genetic   predisposition toward hostility   among all Klingons, although Worf   does seem unusually out of sorts.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: He's never been much on charm --
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: Well, whatever troubles him, we   should try to help. He is our   friend.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: And I'd like to keep him   friendly.       Any suggestions?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: Empirical study. Monitor the   subject.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: Right. We'll watch for any   signs of unusual behavior --
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: That shouldn't be difficult --
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: Within the norms of Klingon   patterns, of course.       Discretion will be required.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: Fine. Where do we start?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: We... will assist you as needed.       You found the problem...
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: And you must solve it.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI, DATA, AND WESLEY

quote: ... and after working out the   Fuurinkazan battle strategies   at the Tokyo Base, I was asked   to go to work for Starfleet as   a tactical advisor.
I'm surprised you stayed away from   the action as long as you did --
Hi, Will -- join us? Your father   and I were just catching up --
(ignoring that; to     Pulaski)   You never told me you knew him.
Well... it wasn't exactly a   secret... but it never really came   up --
Pull up a stool, son --
I'm ready for your briefing   whenever you are, sir.
You think Worf is going to   appreciate being observed like   some laboratory specimen?
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: You are correct. He is not   insensitive... particularly at   this stage of his development.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Just remember, this is Wesley's   operation, okay?
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Wesley is quite competent.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: You guys aren't going to believe   this...
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Believe what?
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Commander Riker just caught me   coming out of the turbolift.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: So? This area isn't off limits   to you.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: I know, but I've been working on   Paracelsian computations as part   of my studies and he wants them   right away.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: What about Worf?
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: When Commander Riker says right   away he means right away.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Indeed.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: You guys can cover for me, can't   you?
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Wait a minute. This whole   thing --
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: I've got to get my computations   done.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: You don't expect us to --
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Oh, come on. What are friends   for?       Right?
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: Go ahead. Finish your work and   We shall study Worf.
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: I knew I could count on you guys!
scene: A21	INT. CORRIDOR - DATA AND GEORDI

quote: ... good seeing you too, Graham --
You wouldn't be running for mayor,   would you?
Do pick-up work for the Federation   long enough and it'll happen to   you, too.       I thought about you a lot.
Kyle... I don't need to hear what   you don't need to say.
We could've been great together.
Possibly.
Is it true you got married?
Again... and again.
Doesn't that make you three for   three?
I'm not complaining. They were   each good men... and we're all   still good friends.
Like us?
Close... but different.       They were all a little more...   in touch with themselves.
Ouch.

Kyle, face facts. You're   crusty. A reputation for being   hard as nails and getting the   job done. But underneath all   that, you're not so bad. Some   of us even love you.       And then there's Will.
And then there's Will.
Wesley really should be doing this   on his own --
But he needs his study time --
I can't believe you fell for that.       I don't know... he looks pretty   normal to me.
In solitude there is nothing to   trigger unusual behavior.
Good point. Let's not tamper with   the status quo...
That would defeat the opportunity   for our behavioral research.       The probabilities are that he's   simply lonely. We can relieve   his anxieties through   socialization --
Be my guest.
Excuse me, Lieutenant --
You seem to have lost the will   to communicate with others.
You have friends here. We care   about you. Why, just awhile ago,   Wesley, Geordi and I were saying   how --
Sir... with all due respect...   BE GONE!
He seems quite sincere in his   desire for solitude.
(smugly, the pun     intentional)   Seeing is believing, huh?
Come in.
Yes, Worf?
May I have a moment, sir?
What is it?
It is difficult to say... words   are not always easy for me...    (then, distracted by     the pictures)   Is that Earth?
Yes. Alaska... I was nine   there...
(intrigued; re the     picture)   That is a big fish you are   holding.
I didn't even catch that fish.
You were holding it like --
I hooked it... but my father took   the pole... wouldn't even let me   reel it in... he said I might lose   it.
You do not have good feelings   for your father?
I'm... not sure how I feel right   now...
You have much on your mind.
Yes.       What is on yours?
The Enterprise has been good to   me...
To all of us.
It has been my home... but still,   I am alone here.
Not true. You have many friends   here, just as I have --
Then why do you make ready to   leave the Enterprise?
I've been offered my own command,   something I've trained for...
And what of your friends?
Friendship is something we carry   in our hearts... We can feel it   wherever we are.
Yes. On Kling we say, "Tez mrot   weilz konpadam": One is always   of his tribe.       I would like to join you on the   Ares.
Thank you, Worf. But I haven't   accepted the assignment yet --
But sir... it could be a   dangerous mission. There may   be the potential for combat.
That's not the purpose of the   mission.
Still -- to die a true hero --
Worf. Your point is made.
Then I know you will do the right   thing, sir.
Finally. We're alone. Maybe --
I'm here for the briefing, sir.
All you need to know is here.
The mission details could've been   transmitted --
I've been hearing good things   about you.
Why didn't I ever hear from you?

I know. Keeping in touch isn't   my strong suit.       Funny thing about being a parent.   There aren't any tech manuals,   no quick readouts to get you to   the next set of variables. You   just kind of wing it from day to   day... Will, when your mother   died --
Excuse me, sir, but I need to   study this briefing material...
Will. I came to the Enterprise   because... look, considering   where you might be going, I wanted   to...       I'm here with my hand out,   son --
Poor guy. Picked up a flu virus   on our last stop at Nasreldine.
Sounds nasty. What's the   therapy?
Tryptophan-lysine distillates   with generous doses of PCS.
PCS?
"Pulaski's Chicken Soup."
You've still got the touch,   haven't you?
I like to help. When they hurt,   I hurt.
Commander Pulaski's greatest   medical skill is her empathy.       You must be Commander Riker's   father.
Yes, but how --
We've all heard about you.       And I've felt certain things.
This is Deanna Troi, ship's   counselor.
Kyle Riker.
I thought you two should meet.       Troi's job is to keep us from   deluding ourselves.
Let me guess: Betazoid?
At your service.
I've got some lab work to do, so   if you'll excuse me...
Why do I get the feeling this is   a set-up?
Because you are intelligent,   wise... and quite correct.
(re Troi;     appreciatively)   I've been set up with worse,   that's for sure --
You're also anxious about   something. It's your son, isn't   it? You're not as close to him   as you'd like to be...
Oh, I don't know. Wouldn't you   say we both have pretty good taste   in women?
I'd like to help if I can. If   you allow me.
Fine. What do you want from me?   I came here to bury the hatchet   with Will and I find out the   ground is frozen solid.
You're not the kind of man who   gives up so easily.
I didn't say I was giving up.   It would just be nice to get a   little something from him.
What is it you want from him?
I don't know. Acknowledgement,   maybe... or --
Respect is earned, not bestowed.
Respect? I don't need that from   him.
Perhaps you want him to be proud   of you, for you carry great pride   in his accomplishments --
Absolutely! Look at him! First   officer on the Enterprise, just   offered his first command --
Yet... You covet his success --
Please. He'd be lucky to have   the career I've had!
True. You are well respected in   your field.
I may have something of a   reputation for excellence --
And false humility.
My guess is that Will finds you   pretty fascinating. Candor seems   to be a trait he admires.
Honesty is the trait he admires.       You're very competitive with him,   aren't you?
Maybe... in the past. But I'm   here to help Will prepare for his   first mission as captain.
Are you sure he'll accept such   a dangerous assignment?
He'll take it just because it is   so dangerous.
How can you be so sure?
Because I would. And we aren't   so different, Will and I...
I've seen your mission briefing.
Yes, sir.
Any questions?
No sir.       Other than a mention of the Ares's   first officer.
His name is Flaherty, as I recall.
That's right. The briefing said   something about uncanny linguistic   skills.
Correct. The last time I saw him,   Commander Flaherty spoke over   forty languages. Klingon,   Romulan, Giamon, and Stroyerian   were among the more colorful, as   I recall...
He speaks alien dialects?
He has the unique ability of   instantaneously interpreting,   collating, and extrapolating any   verbal communication he hears.       You should find him helpful in   Sector Vega-Omicron.
I'm sure I will.
Enter.
Captain Picard. At last.       I'd like to thank you for all the   help you've been to my son --
My only regret is that your   reunion will mark Will's farewell.
He's ready for this command.
I have no doubt --
Captain? May I have a word with   my son?
Of course... excuse me,   gentlemen...
I won't be pushed into this.
Oh, come on, Willy. Don't you   think you're ready for the   Ares -- ?
Starfleet does.
Of course. You're the best   candidate for this job. But I   want you to know I'm here if you   need me...
I've been on my own since I was   fifteen. I can take care of   myself.
Please! Spare me the "pain" of   your childhood. I hung in there   for thirteen years. If that   wasn't enough, then that's just   too bad.
Maybe I missed something --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: The ship's computer would have   corrected immediately --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: My inputs could have been in   error --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Geordi! Data! I figured out   Worf's problem --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: You spoke to him?
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: No, no. I accessed the complete   Klingon cultural database. It   took some time, but --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Okay, Wesley. What is the   problem?
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: It's the tenth anniversary of   Worf's Age of Ascension.
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: His what?
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: The Age of Ascension is a   Klingon ritual of great   significance. A rite of   initiation, marking a new level   of Klingon spiritual attainment.
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Of what significance is the   anniversary of this event?
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: It's a day of ritual and   celebration with one's fellow   Klingons... and he doesn't have   any Klingon friends.
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: But we're his friends --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: But we don't practice Klingon   tradition. And we're not   Klingons.       Worf's feeling socially...   culturally isolated.
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Well, what do you suggest? I'm   not sure I'd like to invite a   bunch of Klingons on board --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: We can program the ship's computer   to provide us with simulations   on the Holodeck --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Holographic Klingons? Sure. Why   not?
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: We need only to program the   computer with details of the   specific ceremony...
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: The cultural database said the   initiate's family must be   present --
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: So? We're his family. We'll go.       I just wonder what kind of party   the Klingons had in mind...
scene: 32   INT. MAIN ENGINE ROOM - GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Do you have a minute?
Sure...
I wanted to apologize for my   remarks in Ten-Forward. Your past   is none of my business.
Even if it involves your father?
Yes. Even if it involves my   father.
Did he ever tell you why he never   remarried?
What woman would have him? With   an ego like his --

I would have. In a cold minute.       Twelve years ago, Kyle Riker was   a civilian strategist advising   Starfleet in its conflict with   the Tholians. The starbase he   was working from was attacked.   None of the base crew was expected   to live. And they all died...   All except your father.       Your father alone had the will   to endure, to face the pain, to   live.
I never knew that about him.
I never saw a man fight so hard   in my life.
And you fell in love?
Yes. And so did he.       But marriage was out of the   question. He had other   priorities...
His career.
You know, if I were you... going   out on the Ares, I'd jettison   the emotional baggage you're   still carrying around.
Now the Klingon cultural database   was very specific on the setting.
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: Let me guess: A twenty-piece   orchestra in a magnificent   ballroom. Everybody in formal   wear --
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: There's an unusual test of   inner strength involved --
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: I believe that will entail the   use of Klingon "painstiks."
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: "Painstiks"? Sounds lovely --
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: Enduring physical suffering is   considered a Klingon spiritual   test.
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: You mean... for Worf to celebrate   the anniversary of his   Ascension... he has to be hurt?   And we have to witness this?
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: We are his family.
scene: 34   INT. ENGINEERING - DATA, WESLEY, AND GEORDI

quote: Come.
Everything in order, Number One?
I'd be a fool to turn this   promotion down, wouldn't I?

I don't know, and if you're   asking me what I think you should   do, I don't know that either.   But I can spell out, albeit   crudely, what you are choosing   between.       Your present position as first   officer of the Enterprise brings   you prestige, distinction, even   glamour of a kind. You are the   second in command of Starfleet's   flagship -- but still, second in   command. Your promotion will   transfer you to a relatively   insignificant ship in an obscure   corner of the galaxy, but it will   be your ship. Being who you are,   that ship will vibrate with your   authority, your style, your   vision. There is no substitute   for being in the center of the   stage -- any stage.
I'll need a little more time   before I'll have a decision.
Granted.
They find anything yet?
Not yet...
There is nothing to find.
No harm in checking, I guess.
Really? How would you like   them giving your transporter   operation a little once-over?
No problem. We're totally   ship-shape.
You miss the point. It's just   the idea that they even suspect   a malfunction.
Geordi, let them look.
Chief, will you be able to attend   a little party for Worf at   seventeen hundred hours?
A party for Worf? That sounds   intriguing. I'd be delighted --
It's a surprise, okay?
My lips are sealed.
I didn't want to leave without   saying good-bye.
I don't like good-byes. How about   "until next time"?
Until next time.
It's been a pleasure serving with   you, Commander.
That's mutual, Counselor.
I'm supposed to know how everyone   feels... but I... I can't read   you right now.
Maybe your own feelings are   getting in the way --
My job is to help others sort   out their emotions. My own   feelings are beside the point --
Not to me. Feelings are what   make us human --
Are you feeling sadness?
Yes.
So am I.
I'll be leaving at twenty-one   hundred hours. May I have a   minute?
Look, I've been giving you my best   Academy courtesy -- but it's   really time for you to go.
It's time for us to talk, so lower   your shields and --
I'm asking you to leave, or I'll --
You'll what?       Y'know, it's really a shame   there's no anbo-jyutsu ring nearby,   because you need to be put in your   place.
Really? There is. Deck Twelve.   The gymnasium.
Why don't we clear the air once   and for all -- ?
You're on.
Captain's log, Stardate 42686.9.
Ship's scuttlebutt has it that   you wanted to see me.
That's right...       I thought I knew you, Kyle.
You do. About as well as   anyone --
Then what's this about an   anbo-jyutsu match with Will?
You heard.
Haven't we grown beyond the point   where we resolve our problems   through physical conflict?
I think you're overreacting --
I'm overreacting. You're the one   who's going to fight his own son!
It's not a fight, Kate. Think   of it as more of a... "contest."
And suppose one of you is injured?
I know where to find a good   doctor.
Don't patronize me, Kyle.
Look. Will and I started playing   anbo-jyutsu when he was eight.   He knows how to handle himself...   and so do I.
Well, don't take this the wrong   way, but Will's in his prime,   and --
-- And I'm no spring chicken, I   know.       Don't worry. He's never been able   to beat me.
Computer... Is this it?
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: Correct. Klingon Rite of   Ascension Chamber.
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: Is this really necessary?
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: If we're going to get Worf through   his problem, it is.
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: Computer... may we please have   Klingon personnel appropriate for   this event?
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: These images are specifically   programmed for Ascension rites.
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: Cute bunch.
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: And they use those?
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: Those are Klingon painstiks. I   once saw one of them used against   a two-ton Rectyne Monopod. Poor   creature jumped five meters at   the slightest touch. Finally died   from excessive cephalic pressures --
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: You don't mean... ?
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: That's right. The animal's head   exploded just like --
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: I think that's enough, Chief   O'Brien.
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: Are we ready?
scene: 44   INT. HOLODECK - DATA, GEORDI, AND WESLEY (OPTICAL)

quote: I do not enjoy riddles,   Counselor.
You will enjoy this one.
I am in no mood for trifling or   games! Not today!
I know what an important day this   is for you: The anniversary of   your Rite of Ascension.
You know about that?
Yes. All your friends on board   do.
That is impossible. The Rite of   Ascension is a secret known only   to Klingons --
-- And certain resourceful young   Ensigns...
Wesley? What does he know about   it -- ?
Enough. Now just bear with me.
Where are we going?
The Holodeck.
This truly tries my patience,   Counselor.
I think you will approve.
You are not going in?
No.
Open.
An Ascension ceremony? For me?
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: Happy anniversary, Worf.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: Thank you... oh, thank you!
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: Shall we begin?
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: Oh, yes. Please!
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: DaHjaj SuvwI''e' jIH. tIgwIj   Sa'angNIS. 'Iw bIQtIqDaq jIjaH.   Today I am a Warrior. I must   show you my heart. I travel the   river of blood.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: The true test of Klingon strength   is to admit one's most profound   feelings... while under extreme   duress.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: jIbechrup may' vIlos.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: The battle is mine. I crave only   the blood of the enemy.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: HIHIvqa'.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: The bile of the vanquished flows   over my hands.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: may'pequ' moH.
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: Thank you, my friends. Thank   you... You have my respect. My   admiration. My eternal gratitude --
scene: 46   INT. HOLODECK - THE RITE OF ASCENSION CHAMBER

quote: Is Worf all right?
He's never been happier.
Then it was a good ceremony?
Let's just say I wasn't about to   stay for the refreshments.
Klingon culture is not to your   taste?
I'm just glad humans have   progressed beyond the need for   such barbaric displays.
Have they? Commander Riker and   his father are up on the Holodeck   about to engage in barbarism of   their own.
Don't remind me. It's not   something of which I approve --
In spite of human evolution, there   seem to be certain traits endemic   to gender.
You think they're going to knock   each other's brains out just   because... they're men?
Males are certainly unique. In   adulthood, fathers continue to   regard their sons as children...   and sons continue to chafe against   what they perceive as their   fathers' expectations of them.
It's almost as if they never   really grow up at all, isn't it?
Perhaps that's why men remain so   attractive.
Particularly men like Commander   Riker?
As well as his father, I'm sure...
I just hope they don't hurt each   other up there...
Anbo-jyutsu. The ultimate   evolution of the martial arts.
I remember my early lessons.
You could never get used to the   sightless factor... or to losing.
True. But I've had fifteen years   of practice.
Then let's see if you've learned   anything...
Yoroshiku-onegaishimasu! Yoroshiku-onegaishimasu!
You have been practicing.
And remembering.       You never should've let her die.
Yoroshiku-onegaishimasu.
Good. Get it all out!
Yoroshiku-onegaishimasu.
Matta!
I had you.
Will, listen. You were too young   to understand -- and I was too hurt   to explain.
You've never been hurt by   anything.
She was your mother, but she was   my wife -- and when she died...   all that kept me going was you.
You had a strange way of showing   it.

Damnit, Will -- you were barely   out of diapers. You hardly knew   her. I loved her. Of course   you've had the pain... and so have   I. I should have tried to   explain all of this long ago,   but it hurt too much. Then a   wall went up between us... and   living there, just you and me...   the wall got bigger.
Why didn't we move away? Start   over?

I promised her. It was the life   she wanted for you... so...       I came here thinking we could   talk this out. But maybe you're   right. Maybe I'm no father at   all... and you're no son. Maybe   this... this fight is all we have   left.
Matta!
What is it now?
You can't do that!
What?
Hachidan kiritsu! That's   illegal --
You're kidding.
All those years... That's why I   could never win... you were   cheating!
Hey, it worked. Kept you coming   back for more.
I always hated that... and you   were just cheating! Incredible!   How'd you get away with it?
You were just a kid.       Once you were twelve, I knew I   couldn't take you... but I had   to keep you interested...   challenged... didn't I?
Y'know, I can talk to a roomful   of admirals about anything in   the galaxy... but why can't I talk   to you about how I feel?
How do you feel?
How do you think, Will?       I love you, son.
Really?
Really.
I've got to get back to Starbase   Montgomery...
I know.       I'm glad you came.
You be careful, okay?
Starbase Montgomery briefing   specialist and analytical team   have beamed down, sir.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: What were the analytical team's   findings?
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: They suggested we reprogram the   system to correct the readout   variables.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Precisely what Data recommended,   as I recall. But it did give   Commander Riker the time he   needed to consider his promotion.   Now that he's accepted it, we can   leave him at Starbase Montgomery.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Number One?
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Captain... with your permission,   I've decided to remain on the   Enterprise.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: ... granted.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Thank you, sir.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Take us out of orbit,   Mister Crusher.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Terminating synchronous orbit.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Set course for Beta Kupsic...   That is still our next   destination?
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: ... Velocity - warp factor five.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Course and speed set.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Any particular reason for this   change of heart?
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Motivated self-interest. Right   now the best place for me to be   is right here.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW

quote: Engage.
scene: 57   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE BRIDGE CREW
